briefdescription.para: Opaque object representing a socket file descriptor transport.

memberdef.name: socket_vtable
memberdef.initializer: = { socket_finalize, socket_handle_watch, socket_disconnect, socket_connection_set, socket_do_iteration, socket_live_messages_changed, socket_get_socket_fd }

detaileddescription.para:
Todo
We need to have a way to wake up the select sleep if a new iteration request comes in with a flag (read/write) that we're not currently serving.Otherwise a call that just reads could block a write call forever (if there are no incoming messages).

briefdescription.para: Creates a new transport for the given socket file descriptor.

detaileddescription.para: The file descriptor must be nonblocking (use _dbus_set_fd_nonblocking() to make it so). This function is shared by various transports that boil down to a full duplex file descriptor.

parameterdescription.para: non-NULL if this transport is on the server side of a connection

simplesect.para: the new transport, or NULL if no memory.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *host, const char *port, const char *family, const char *noncefile, DBusError *error)
memberdef.name: _dbus_transport_new_for_tcp_socket

briefdescription.para: Creates a new transport for the given hostname and port.

detaileddescription.para: If host is NULL, it will default to localhost

parameterdescription.para: the address family to connect to
location to store reason for failure.

simplesect.para: a new transport, or NULL on failure.

parameterdescription.para: the address entry to try opening as a tcp transport.
return location for the opened transport
